intro: Rhynchosia bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's burr legume, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to dry environments. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by hairy, spiny pods that contain the seeds. Rhynchosia bakeri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions.
